title: Autoimmune Diseases Overview
content:
You may need to see your healthcare provider more than once to identify the problem.
####  How are autoimmune diseases treated? 
Currently, autoimmune diseases can't be cured. However, there are treatments that can help you manage your symptoms and slow down the progression of your disease. These may be in the form of tablets or injections. Your treatment will depend on the particular autoimmune condition that you have. Your healthcare provider will advise on the best treatment options for you.
####  What self-care can I do if I have an auto-immune disease? (+ APPS) 
In general, lifestyle changes can significantly help with managing the symptoms of many autoimmune diseases. Consider:
  * maintaining a healthy diet and a healthy weight
  * getting enough rest and sleep
  * exercising regularly in a way that suits you
  * reducing stress and getting enough support. 


####    
Apps reviewed by Healthify
You may find it useful to look at some [nutrition, exercise and weight management apps](https://healthify.nz/apps/n/nutrition-exercise-and-weight-management-apps) and [mental health and wellbeing apps](https://healthify.nz/apps/m/mental-health-and-wellbeing-apps).
####  What support is available if I have an auto-immune disease? 
[Autoimmune NZ(external link)](https://autoimmune.org.nz/ "Open external link") provides support and resources for people affected by autoimmune diseases. Email info@autoimmune.org.nz or phone 021 244 4544. There’s also a private Facebook page.
There are also support organisations for people with different autoimmune diseases. Try searching the name of your condition in [the support section on the Healthify website](https://healthify.nz/support) to see what’s available.
